data.q: Which HTML5 element is used to embed video content in a webpage?
data.explanation: The <video> element is specifically designed to embed video content in HTML5.

data.q: Which method of the CanvasRenderingContext2D is used to draw rectangles?
data.explanation: The fillRect(x, y, width, height) method draws a filled rectangle on the canvas.

data.q: What attribute of the <audio> element allows playback controls to be displayed?
data.explanation: The controls attribute adds play, pause, and volume controls to the audio element.

data.q: Which JavaScript API is commonly used for 2D graphics rendering in the browser?
data.explanation: The Canvas API provides methods for drawing 2D graphics directly in the browser.

data.q: Which property of the HTMLMediaElement indicates whether the media is paused?
data.explanation: The paused property returns true if the media is currently paused.

data.q: Which method is used to start playback of an HTMLMediaElement?
data.explanation: The play() method starts playback of audio or video elements.

data.q: Which Web API provides access to the user's camera and microphone?
data.explanation: Accessing camera/microphone typically involves Navigator.mediaDevices.getUserMedia(), part of WebRTC and MediaStream APIs.

data.q: Which attribute of the tag specifies alternative text if the image cannot be displayed?
data.explanation: The alt attribute provides alternative text for accessibility and when the image fails to load.

data.q: Which CSS property is commonly used to apply filters like blur or grayscale to images?
data.explanation: The filter property allows applying visual effects such as blur, brightness, or grayscale.

data.q: Which JavaScript object represents an image that can be drawn onto a canvas?
data.explanation: HTMLImageElement objects can be created and drawn onto a canvas using drawImage().
